reviewText: Our entire family enjoys this series.  This DVD is wonderful just like all of these in the drive thru history series.  We highly recommend this movie.

reviewText: I have only seen 3 of the series so far, however; I can say that it follows the secular text I use in Western Civilization, almost to a "T".  There is nothing in these 3 videos that is not appropriate for a public/secular school.  Many of the movements (Reformation, Separatists (Pilgrims) coming to America, The Puritans, etc.) ARE religious in nature and can not be excluded from history by those who are anti-religion.
summary: Adjunct Professor gives this an A!
Title: N/A

reviewText: While all of Dave Stotts' episodes may not be ideal for a public school classroom (too christianity-centric), they are all interesting, entertaining, educational and come with top-notch production quality. This is not a talking head video series!Episode #3 of this disk (Phoenicians, Carthage, gladiators, etc.) does a great job of reviewing Roman history and covers how Christianity represented a break from Roman values in a professional (non-conversion-seeking) manner. Episode #3 will most likely wind up in the end of unit review of my rather lenghty Roman Empire chapter.The other sections will be welcome at my home and my adult Bible study classes.I give this series a solid "A"
summary: The review of a public school world history teacher
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw this episode on TV and was wishing afterward that I had taped it! So I hit the web and found this disc to buy. Have since bought several episodes from other sites (sorry amazon). This one....The Arch of Titus has such an amazing history and weird to see how small it is and what a shame people mill about seemingly unaware, as I would if not for this disc! The destruction of Jerusalem just leaves one stunned that the Jewish people have survived at all, much less the city itself. Then there's the Circus Maximus and the Pantheon....no one will keep reading such a long review! Let's just say I HIGHLY recommend this disc AND the whole series.You don't have to be religious but if you are, you'll love it more. Lots of archeological links to the Bible. You DO have to be into history or else you may be bored, though it's so interesting that it will probably spark a new interest. Not only is it a miracle Jews are still here, but Nero etc did his best to wipe out the Christians too. We also see some roots of anti-semitism. The only way the jews could have money while escaping was to swallow the coins. Hence the "jews are so greedy they eat money" hatred.The host Dave Stotts has a good sense of humor and makes it all fun too. Light enough for kids too and a good way to teach respect for the worlds rich history and the suffering will put things in perspective for the whole family. You'll be damn glad you have the problems you do as opposed to being alive then.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Rome If You Want To" is a very informative dvd on the development and history of Rome.  There are 3 main episodes that cover the following:1.  Emperors of Rome, destruction of Jerusalem, Forum and Palatine Hill.2.  Circus Maximus, chariot racing, great fire of Rome, Nero's persecution of Christians.3.  Hannibal invades Rome, Colosseum, gladiators, Christian influence on Rome.The DVD is just over 90 minutes and may be watched in one viewing.  You will learn much about Rome's history, what caused her greatness, and what brought her downfall.Watching the DVD makes me want to visit Rome someday and see the sites for myself.Dave Stotts, the narrator, mixes humor and reverance during the DVD and is very entertaining and keeps your interest.Highly recommended for anyone who wants to know more about one of the most influential cities of early history.
summary: Drive Through History - Rome If You Want To
Title: N/A

reviewText: Watch Dave Stotts drive a Smart Car around Rome and fight as a "pretend" gladiator while presenting New Testament history in a highly entertaining way. I bought the first two disks for my kids, thoroughly enjoyed them myself, and will definitely buy the second two. Focus On The Family commissioned this excellent series. Sometimes Dave gets a little silly, and it's all in the name of making what could be a boring topic more interesting. The re-telling of the legend of the founding of Rome is hilarious, and to say more would be a giveaway. The audio commentary is unique - the filmmakers recorded it in a moving car while traveling through Colorado.
summary: First installment of an excellent series
Title: N/A
